abstract: Shareholders of the Lear Corporation, the automotive seat maker, rejected Carl C. Icahn’s $2.9 billion buyout offer, handing a victory to a group of investors who led a five-month battle against the sale of the company. The company announced the result at its shareholder meeting today in Wilmington, Del., Bloomberg News reported. Lear, based in Southfield, Mich., did not immediately give details of the vote tally.
lead_paragraph: Shareholders of the Lear Corporation, the automotive seat maker, rejected Carl C. Icahn’s $2.9 billion buyout offer, handing a victory to a group of investors who led a five-month battle against the sale of the company. The company announced the result at its shareholder meeting today in Wilmington, Del., Bloomberg News reported. Lear, based in Southfield, Mich., did not immediately give details of the vote tally.

headline.main: Lear Shareholders Vote Against Icahn Offer
